title: Fraudsters resorting to low-tech thefts in car parks as banks tighten up on card fraud
text:
Fraudsters are resorting to low-tech thefts in car parks as banks tighten up on card fraud.

Criminals are impersonating car park attendants and needy members of the public in a bid to steal bank cards, according to UK Finance.

Driven to distraction: Criminals are impersonating car park attendants and needy members of the public in a bid to steal bank cards

It noted examples where fraudsters impersonating car park attendants tell victims they face a fine and frogmarch them to a card machine.

The victim is distracted while inserting their card — before it is stolen.

Victims are also duped by criminals who pretend they have forgotten their cards and offer cash in exchange for borrowing one.

UK Finance is urging people to be wary of anyone who makes an approach at a card machine.
